item.title: Report E-2025040407
item.description:
Report E-2025040407

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 16, 2025, one (1) 3.2-gallon jug of UN2922 was damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and a neutralizing agent to remediate the dock. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025040335
item.description:
Report E-2025040335

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-12T03:42:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-19
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2212 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BAT. It was reported that approximately 1-pound of " Chlorpyrifos" released from (2) plastic bags due to improper loading. The release impacted inside of trailer #3193654. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site due to googles being required; XPO felt comfortable cleaning up the spill. XPO will place the waste inside of a 55-galloon poly drum. ERTS generated waste ID 231097-1. ERTS notified Chemtrec, Esther provided report # 2025031900218.
